00029    template <typename Data>
00030    class Matrix
00031    {
00032 
00033    public:
00034 
00035       // Protected default constructor, to prohibit direct instantiation.
00036 
00037       // Private copy constructor, to prohibit copy construction.
00038 
00042       virtual ~Matrix();

00050

00111    template <typename Data>
00112    inline Matrix<Data>::Matrix()
00113     : data_(0),
00114       capacity1_(0),
00115       capacity2_(0)
00116    {}

00119    * Destructor.
00120    */
00121    template <typename Data>
00122    inline Matrix<Data>::~Matrix()
00123    {}

00125    /*
00126    * Get number of rows.
00127    */
00128    template <typename Data>
00129    inline int Matrix<Data>::capacity1()
00130    { return capacity1_; }
00131 
00132    /*
00133    * Get number of columns.
00134    */
00135    template <typename Data>
00136    inline int Matrix<Data>::capacity2()
00137    { return capacity2_; }
00138 
00139    /*
00140    * Return element (i,j) of matrix by const reference.
00141    */
00142    template <typename Data>
00143    inline const Data& Matrix<Data>::operator() (int i, int j) const
00144    {
00145       assert(data_ != 0);
00146       assert(i >= 0);
00147       assert(i < capacity1_);
00148       assert(j >= 0);
00149       assert(j < capacity2_);
00150       return *(data_ + i*capacity2_ + j);
00151    }
00152 
00153    /*
00154    * Return element (i,j) of matrix by reference.
00155    */
00156    template <typename Data>
00157    inline Data& Matrix<Data>::operator() (int i, int j)
00158    {
00159       assert(data_ != 0);
00160       assert(i >= 0);
00161       assert(i < capacity1_);
00162       assert(j >= 0);
00163       assert(j < capacity2_);
00164       return *(data_ + i*capacity2_ + j);
00165    }

00168 }
